_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five warriors found in the world [an: The warrior who falters and founders at the mere sight of a cloud of dust
The warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust, but falters and founders at the mere sight of a banner’s crest
The warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest, but falters and founders at the mere sound of turmoil
The warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil, but is killed or injured when blows are struck
The warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil and being struck. He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
The five people similar to warriors foun: The monk who falters and founders at the mere sight of a cloud of dust
The monk who can prevail over a cloud of dust, but falters and founders at the mere sight of a banner’s crest
The monk who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest, but falters and founders at the mere sound of turmoil
The monk who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil, but is killed or injured when blows are struck
The monk who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil and being struck. He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
